meanings.definition: A person regarded as disreputable or sleazy.
meanings.sent1: That skank over there is always causing trouble.
meanings.sent2: The neighborhood was known for its skanks who would gossip all day.
meanings.sent3: The skank tried to cheat her way out of paying for her meal.
meanings.sent4: Her behavior at the party was a true display of a skank.
meanings.sent5: The movie villain was portrayed as a skank with evil intentions.

meanings.definition: To dance in a sexually suggestive manner.
meanings.sent1: She loves to skank at the club on weekends.
meanings.sent2: The dancers at the party started to skank to the music.
meanings.sent3: He decided to skank his way through the dance competition for fun.
meanings.sent4: The couple's skanking on the dance floor caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: The music was so catchy that even the shyest person couldn't resist skanking.

meanings.definition: A style of music combining elements of reggae and punk rock.
meanings.sent1: The band's new album has a unique skank sound that fans love.
meanings.sent2: Skank music always gets the crowd moving at concerts.
meanings.sent3: The skank playing on the radio made everyone want to dance.
meanings.sent4: The skank rhythm in the song added an energetic vibe to the performance.
meanings.sent5: Listening to skank music instantly puts me in a good mood.
